title: SALT Center Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: The in-person interviews usually begin with a one-on-one interview with the hiring manager. During this initial meeting, the interviewer typically asks questions about the candidate's qualifications, skills, work history and relevant experience.
Interview Questions: asks questions about the candidate's qualifications, skills, work history and relevant experience.

title: Section Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Met with head of program and existing ISTA Section Leaders. Gave a presentation on assigned topic relevant to course I wanted to be an SL for. Helped a "student" with a programming error live.
Interview Questions: How would you go about helping this student? (needed help understanding an issue with Python code)

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Chandler, AZ) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: easy questions and down to earth people, interview process was painless. I would come prepared with range salary and questions. I dont have anything else really to say about the experience.
Interview Questions: What qualifies you for this position

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview where you get asked questions as well as you ask questions. Followed by a hands-on excel check where you follow some instructions on paper. Nothing too hard, but maybe different than what you're used to.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness ?

title: UTA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough with the interview process no cut-around. It was a clear-cut presentation of what we will go through in the position and I was given the chance to show skills that would fit the position well.
Interview Questions: Answering a particular math question.

title: New Student Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: There was a large group interview with about 20 students and then an individual interview by invitation. The questions were pretty standard, and they were clearly reading off of a script. During the group interview they have us play games to see how we worked with each other.
Interview Questions: Why did you come to the U of A?

title: Contract Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview were in two blocks: the first was good, more than 40 minutes of questions. The second block were supposed to be 2 people but one couldn`t be there, the other one randomly selected questions from the screen. Really uncomfortable and rigid. Never got an answer about the process.
Interview Questions: More than one hour of behavioral questions.

title: Surgeon Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Paid for the travel Great experience, there was provision for travel reimbursement. Also, there was time to tour the environment. Everyone was nice and friendly. Top on my list of job choices.
Interview Questions: Why U of A Family dynamics

title: Project Coorindator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Phoenix, AZ) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy, but very unresponsive interviewers. Some interview questions were posed in such a way that implied you had already failed at a task in their organization. Not sure what the goal with that was.
Interview Questions: I do not recall the exact question.

title: Think Tank Team Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy get to know you first part, they just ask what you’d do in different scenarios, the second part is entirely an exam on the subject you want to tutor
Interview Questions: What would you say to a student who comes in thinking you can’t possibly help them?

title: HAI Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applications opened in July. Campus invites did not happen until the fall. Campus visit in Fall (very disorganized, inconsistent information and experiences across candidates). They did not follow up with offers until January/February. Rejection at the end of February.
Interview Questions: Basic academic questions: research agenda, funding, mentoring, goals, etc.

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Quick. Submitted my application and was asked for an interview within a week. Wanted to interview me next day, but I didn't have the time. Interviewed on the next Monday, and was offered the position by Friday evening of the same week.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years? Why did you want to work for us? Are you willing to be in-person full-time?

title: IT Systems Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Short, asked about front end and back end support, troubleshooting knowledge, remote knowledge, hardware support, past experiences, what kind of person you are and your goals. They also talked a lot about work life balance as well as what my extracurriculars were.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself in 3 words

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Typical tell about your self and past work experience.  Was interviewed by manager and director.  Interview was quick not much to it. Walked away with a job offer.  Now Im just typing to meet the 30 word limit on this damn section.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: WCMC Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview processes asked questions about why you want this position, questions about yourself, at least one scenario question. In the end, they asked what site(s) you would like to work at.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to tutor?

title: Online Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: I received a voice mail from a recruiter stating that I was selected to meet with the hiring manager for a position. I called the number back several times and was finally able to reach the recruiter after about a week. The recruiter said they would be emailing me some times to schedule the virtual meeting. I did not receive the email. I tried for another week to call the recruiter back and finally once again reached them. They promised the email was on the way. I never received it. I reached out to the recruiter another few times and also to the university with no response.
Interview Questions: I did not ever make it to an actual interview.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions:
Two interviews. A group of six people from the department, including an assistant to the dean.  
There was a surprise Excel and writing test at the end of the second interview.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in five years? 
Many "example" questions were posed. 
Suprise Excel and writing test.

title: Public Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: After a lengthy process of getting to then interview, I met with my direct supervisor and a board hiring committee. Overall I think it was standard and a great experience to learn from!
Interview Questions: How would I fit I to their current system?

title: Director of Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: There were eight people on a Zoom call. The questions were fairly standard. A couple of the people seemed engaged and warm, but the rest didn't show any expression. I didn't feel super welcome.
Interview Questions: What is your management style?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Sent in the application. Had a zoom interview that lasted about 30 minutes with basic behavioral questions and questions about past work experience. Overall, felt well prepared and questions were not too complicated.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had almost no interview at all. A professor offered me the job outright after asking me 'Hey man, are you in this class?' Training was minimal. I was effectively told to do whatever I wanted so everyone in the class did great.
Interview Questions: Are you biased for or against any freshmen?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I did not go through a formal interview process but it was primarily concerns of how to make the university a better place and more inclusive of students. A very rewarding job
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself?

title: Athletics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: You have a zoom meeting with two of your supervisors where they ask you questions about interest and what you have to offer. The interview is fairly straightforward and they do not ask any crazy questions.
Interview Questions: They asked why I was interested in compliance?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by several staff members all at once in a conference room each with their own questions including the director, hiring manager and other staff members. Only 1 interview was required.
Interview Questions: What you do if someone requests that you copy more than 10% of a book for them?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: only one zoom online meeting. about 5 people interviewed me. before the meeting, a test should be finished. After you finish the test, you will get the interview. The test is easy but is very wield.
Interview Questions:
experience regrading HTML ,CSS AND JAVASCRIPT.
how to explain technical questions to non-tech people?

title: Student Affairs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: SLOW process with little to no communication.  Received an interview but was ghosted after that and I am an internal candidate. So unprofessional and rude to treat people like they don't matter. I can only imagine how they treat external candidates.
Interview Questions: Tell us a difficult situation you have experienced at work and how you handled it.

title: Tech Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: The response to my application was fairly quick  I was contacted by a recruiter in about a week. The recruiter was very nice. She described the position in detail and asked if I was still interested. The recruiter asked what interested me about the position. Them proceeded to ask specific questions about my background and experience. She asked about experience working remotely and if I was okay with doing that full time. Then, we talked about salary.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at UAGC?

title: Information Technology Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Standard review process: initial screening, Zoom interview, and followed up by an in-person interview. The initial screening was over the phone and was conducted by a single individual. The virtual and in-person interviews were conducted by a panel, which consisted of the hiring manager, the department head, and one faculty member from the department.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work in Higher Education?

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: After filling the online application on the ThinkTank website and emailing it, there would be an interview that covers the typical questions asked in addition to forming a mock Supplemental Instruction (SI) Session.
Interview Questions: How would you encourage collaborative learning?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: The interview process quite simple. This experience was three years ago and I enjoyed everyone that I interacted with. The first interview was a phone and then an inperson interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in outreach counseling?

title: Student Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was really quick and easy. They were friendly and polite and asked good questions that gave insight into the job. They seemed interested in hiring me and made that known, however, I was told there would be a second interview after.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a student who asked you they have no idea how to do their assignment?

title: Student Office Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was incredibly smooth and was just one interview which was relieving. The questions were simple and applicable to any other job. The questions asked are basic and are university-wide, so, any on-campus job has similar questions.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: First, there is a getting-to-know-you round, which basically allows the interviewer to know more about you. After that you have to do a presentation about a topic of your choosing in front of 2 TAs and finally, the third round is the class-simulation round.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a TA? Tell us about yourself.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone call screen lasted about 30 minutes. A couple weeks later there was a Zoom interview with four people from the hiring department. It was mostly standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the University of Arizona.

title: R&D Engineer/Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I applied at the career portal of the University of Arizona. I was asked to submit my resume, cover letter, and sample of my writing skills. After the initial review of application, I was contacted by Departmental Research Manager. Later, I was called for an in-person interview with the Research Manager and then was interviewed by the lab Principal Investigator.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your background and how you see yourself fit for the job

title: Inbound Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: 1 round of interviews, with 2 interviewers. Lasted about 20 minutes and then got an email couple days later. Then after immediately got to training via zoom and google docs.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for admissions?

title: REU Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: It was very straight to the point. They asked me about my work and what I can bring to the lab. They gave me a rundown of what interns do. They asked about strengths, skills, what you need to be successful in the position etc.
Interview Questions: What skills do you think you need to have to be successful in this position

title: UGTA Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Online Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: For the computer science department the interview consists of a technical portion where you try to debug a problem. The other portion is a behavioral where course coordinators will ask why you want that position and you also have to give a 5 min presentation on an CS topic of your choice.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a UGTA?

title: Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Super casual meeting with the manager - even got a free meal out of it. They asked why I wanted the job and what I was studying/involved in on campus
Interview Questions: What does your schedule look like?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: There were six total interviews with University of Arizona faculty over the course of 2 days. Due to the pandemic, interviews were done entirely online. There were many technical difficulties.
Interview Questions: Q: What research have you done?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Arizona State University, AZ) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two professors on a Zoom call, discussed the position responsibilities and research projects. Asked about my previous research experience and experience working with participants and supervising other lab members. Answered questions I had about the project and discussed what the University response was to COVID, work-life balance, etc.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous research experience

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds of interviews and last piece includes a presentation.  There were no group interviews and the questions get harder the further you make it in the process. You need references.
Interview Questions: How would you add value to our department?

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: They make you do a PowerPoint presentation while zooming with them and then they ask a bunch of questions but they do a thorough job to try and get to know you.
Interview Questions: How do you work with a difficult team member.

title: Research Assistant (Independent Study) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: It wws on zoom because of the pandemic. The professor was very friendly and explained the project in great detail. I was given a detailed plan of the semester's goals. I was asked about my skills and interests so that my work experience could be made more rewarding.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in from the learning perspective?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: one interview with decent questions. how do you handle stress, what are your weaknesses, ETC. They interviewed me in a weird room that looked like it was still being constructed
Interview Questions: how do you handle stress

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: My interview was a zoom call with the Principal Investigator of the lab for around 1 hour. We spent time discussing my experience and knowledge and what the position responsibilities entail.
Interview Questions: Lab specific questions focused on conceptual understanding

title: Retention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Firstly, I submitted my application online. After about 10 business days I received the notice to complete a video interview online via Zoom. It's more like an video conference where you answer the questions from interviewers. Then after 2 weeks I received the notice for an onsite interview. The onsite interview took about 30-45min with 3-4 interviewers.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize different tasks?

title: Assistant Professor of Practice Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: This was a national search with three interview rounds: first, a 30 minute phone interview about work history, experience, and questions. Second round was  creating teaching materials and submitting them. Final round was a campus visit with teaching demonstration with potential colleagues and current graduate students.
Interview Questions: Describe your process for developing curriculum.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: the simple and straightforward interview process with the usual questions.  the interviewers were very personable and it felt like a relaxed atmosphere. Having knowledge of the department and various projects was really important and helped the interview along.
Interview Questions: They asked what projects I had worked on in the past.

title: Salesforce.com Administrator Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Nice and easy. People are also really nice. After all, it is a student position. I just need the access to the comment function on Glassdoor honestly. And right now, i have to type 30 words or more. Why it is so difficult.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your work and study?

title: Budget Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: 2:1 in person interview was very friendly and conversational. The interview questions were all behavioral and straight forward. The staff was very personable and made me feel at ease throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had to work in a diverse group on a project.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Arizona State University, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews with different staff members. The last one was about preparing a PP describing a project plan. They were hiring for a certified project manager position but none of the interviewers understood the role of project manager. Extremely bureaucratic, lack of innovation and frankly didi not feel appreciated.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a project that went wrong and what did you do?

title: Computer Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Short interview that asks some basic questions that you would expect to find at an interview ("what would your best friend say about you?" "what are your strengths?"..etc). Nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: How would your best friend describe you?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: one round interview, basic behavior questions such as your team work experience, and how do you deal with your team conflicts. The questions are simple and supervisors are really nice.
Interview Questions: present your examples

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 rounds of in-person interviews for my specific department. Both were with multiple people from the team I would be working closely with, the second interview included the department communications head. Mostly behavioral, get-to-know-me questions during the first interview. The second interview, I was instructed to complete and submit a mini "assignment" to give them a better example of what my work would be like, and the interview was spent discussing that.
Interview Questions: What was the biggest challenge you've had to face thus far and how did you handle it?

title: Director of Special Events Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: After an informal phone call with the HR admin, I had a formal phone call with the HR admin. I graduated to an in-person interview that was with about 6 women, from different divisions in the department.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you want this job.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Committee members during a screening interview were quite rude. Instead of asking genuine questions, they just looked for ways to voice hostility. It ended up feeling like a complete waste of time.
Interview Questions: about methodolgy for my empirical work.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Met in person during a visit and a conference, got to know each other very well. later applied for the position and got set up a telecon interview. During the interview, we chat about my past research and future research interest, chat about the group's future major plan, as well as potential projects.
Interview Questions: What resources do you think will be useful for you to achieve your goals?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: The PI emailed to me to schedule a short interview. It was a short and friendly interview with PI.  The interview lasted for about 15 minutes. He told me that he would email me later for the response.
Interview Questions: What are your goals after graduation? The questions were based on my resume because he wanted to know more about my previous research experience. At that time, I did not have much research experience other than non-related experience like tutoring.

title: Regulatory Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews, one with the overall department managers and one with the team that you will be working with. I found the interviewers to be friendly and laid-back. They seem to be pretty straightforward about what they're looking for, no attempts at tricky questions.
Interview Questions: The questions themselves are pretty standard.

title: GTA Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Positive and welcoming, the faculty want to see your personality. Faculty is highly decorated but did not come across as full of themselves. The program is very well rounded and the talent is unreal.
Interview Questions: What book you are currently reading.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Sit in an interview with Community Director and Current Resident Assistant. Answer multiple questions and the interviewers take notes. It's about a 30 minute interview. It's pretty relaxed so no need to stress.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you made a mistake? How did you react to that mistake and did you learn anything from it?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: There were two interview in person. Followed by a writing sample followed by an offer. Process took about 2 months. People were very nice and respectful during the process. Advice? b e yourself and you will do great!
Interview Questions: Describe your experience with ... insert whatever you do here. Fixation in experience rather than skills and capability.

title: Desk Assistant and Transcriber Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Short 15 minute interview. Most questions are tailored to know more about what was on your resume. There are many give an example of how you would..... questions. The department consists of 3 subsections. When applying, I didn’t know I was applying to all the sections. All supervisors from each section took part of the interview. They  each prepared a printed copy of my resume and took notes while I answered questions.
Interview Questions: What is your knowledge about the resources we provide?

title: Graduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of first a formal online application followed by submission of an official transcript. A few weeks passed for formal acceptance into the program and then graduate recruitment took place.
Interview Questions: What is your research experience?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I wanted to do research, so I approached a lab to see if there was an opening. The Dr. wanted to talk to me about why I wanted to work in his lab. He said to work in the lab for a month and evaluate. I ended up staying for 2 years.
Interview Questions: What are you looking to accomplish in this lab?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Fair interview questions. However, they do NOT go thru a recruiter so took almost 5 weeks to get the job. Had a phone call to come in and have an introduction that turned into an interview.
Interview Questions: Name a time you failed and how you fixed it?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: showed up and they asked me a bunch of questions not really realted the to roll. I later found out that i wasnt applying for the correct rooll and i was wayyy not qualifies for the position.
Interview Questions: How do you teach someone who has sever math anxiety?

title: Contracts Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: When I was selected for an interview, I was given an agenda and asked to come in to meet the senior contracts professionals.  Their administrative staff provided me with an agenda, and even provided me information on where to park.  She was extremely organized.  I came in for the interview, which took about 2-3 hours.  During the interview, I met their staff and they were each able to ask me some questions.
Interview Questions: What would be your dream job (money notwithstanding)?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was asked to come to the University for an in-person interview a couple weeks later. Met with the PI of the lab and was asked typical interview questions. I was offered the position the following week.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this lab?

title: Senior Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the university website and didn't hear anything back for a few months. Then, they called to schedule an in person interview. I had a second interview 2 days after the first interview, and they called to offer me the job the same day.
Interview Questions: What could we be doing better?

title: SALT Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was very throughout and they made sure I was able to fulfill the position without any issues. I was asked hypothetical questions as well to see how I would approach certain situations I may be faced with.
Interview Questions: They asked me what I would do if a student did not know how to find an answer to one of the problems they are on and I had to explain how I would approach the situation.

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: In person meeting with Professor, asked basic questions and asked about your personal schedule. Help a group meeting with other TA's as well. It was super easy and quick.  Fast and to the point.
Interview Questions: Have you done this before

title: CALS Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and invitation to a second interview on campus.  I had to rearrange interview and felt bad so I offered to pay for flight.  They arranged committee schedule, and had to prepare a powerpoint presentation.  Consequently, I did not get the job and am out over 700 dollars, they reimbursed absolutely nothing, never responded to the thank you note or inquiry about status update (took 3 weeks to respond with a rejection).  Personally, it was the worst process and people I have EVER interviewed with.  They were rude, unprofessional and now I am out finances, contacted HR and trying to get some compensation back.  I would highly suggest looking to ANY other university for employment.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?  How do you deal with difficult and angry staff?  (Obviously a poignant question, see above).

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Pretty simple. Applied online, was contacted through email shortly. Set up an in person interview where they asked about my schedule and why I wanted to work there. The interview lasted 10minutes and she was very friendly. They told me I would probably be better at another location because of my school availability and told me the manager would contact me shortly. She contacted me the next day to set up a really informal interview with her the next day. The second interview was just so I could meet the manager and see the location, she told me I got the job and how I would move forward in the process.
Interview Questions: Why the UofA?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Application was submitted through the UACareers site. Once those are in the review period, the unit director for that position will review and call any interested parties for interviewing. Actual questions and process will vary quite a bit depending on manager and college.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: The team was able to make the atmosphere fun and easy. I didn't feel intimidated or nervous at all. I got to talk to the team a bit before we started so it was easier to speak to them ask and answer questions.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Was called after submitting my resume on the Wildcat joblink website.  Interview took place 2 days later, I was asked to prepare a 10 minute lecture on a topic relevant to the role as well.
Interview Questions: What do you do when a student is struggling in your class?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Questions: How would you manage your class?

title: Student Assistance and Accountability Graduate Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I emailed application. It included references, cover letter, and cv. They emailed me with a suggested interview time for the in-person interview. I was able reschedule the in-person interview because I had a flight that day. The interview was with 2 staff members. I was the last person they interviewed so I received an offer very quickly.

title: Desk Assistant Interview

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process for this position. I was just required to submit a resume and was chosen because of the previous grade I had recieved in the course.
Interview Questions: There was no interview process for this position

title: Associate Director of Development Interview

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona

title: Front Desk Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interview 3 times. Over the phone. Took a test. In person.  It was a easy process but took some time to go through.  Person tat interviewed me was very friendly.

title: Sales Associate Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very quick. Interviewer was a key holder of the bookstore with a binder with questions to ask. The questions asked were very easy. I over dressed for the interview.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona in May 2017

I like companies that value fit, though, so this was a wonderful experience for me. After I asked all the questions I had, the interviewer clarified some things from my resume. It was interesting to have an interview flipped on me like that- I am used to asking questions only after answering all the questions the interviewer has for me. Overall, a very good experience.
Interview Questions: What questions do you have for me? Surprisingly, this was actually how the interview started.

title: Academic Advisor Interview

Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
What makes you the best candidate for the job?
How would you handle a situation involving a student where...?
Why do you want to work as an academic advisor?

title: Weight Room Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Very brief, couple questions regarding involvement. Applied on website. A couple weeks after received email regarding informational meeting. At the meeting we each scheduled and individual interview. Interviews consisted of a panel of current employees. Mixture of students.

title: Project Manager Interview

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was short and straight to the point and the atmosphere was not intimidating at all. The atmosphere was comfortable and the interviewers were very friendly.  It did not last more than and one hour.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2017

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was easy, siimply asked me why that I would want a job with them. Tried to explain benefits of working there etc. was a pretty easy process to get through, am hoping to hear back very soon from them. Would reccomend trying to get a job there, should be quite beneficial.
Interview Questions: Favorite thing about the pool

title: Financial Aid Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Arizona (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Geared finding how interpersonal your skills are and how you handle stressful situations. Interview was conducted by a panel, and ranged from easy to harder to answer questions.Asked different questions about how i would handle different financial issues scenarios.
Interview Questions: Asked different questions about how i would handle different financial issues scenarios.

title: Gradurate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1:1 interview. few questions about data warehousing and reporting.let them know about my experience and  got a call after 4 days that i got the job.
IT was pretty easy.got through with a the help of youtube and other online websites .
let them know about my previous experience with infosys.Drew the snowflake and star schema and told them about the merits and demerits about the two.
Interview Questions: what is dimesion modelling/star schema /snow flake ?

title: Student Technical Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: After I applied, they called me to set up a time when I was free for the interview. It was just me and the two supervisors of the department. It was a short 15 minute interview for me, I feel I was very qualified for the position as they offered me the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with supporting the people in your life or in other jobs with their IT problems?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: In person interview, with a panel of 3 members. Simple questions mainly about my previous roles and responsibilities. There were around 15 questions in total and the process took 30 minutes. Initially I got an explanation on the company, its operations, various roles and my to be responsibility. Interviewers made sure that I stay comfortable.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult situation? Tell me about your supervisor? What negative would your supervisor have on you?

title: Group Fitness Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Asked about previous involvement within campus and in health and fitness community and what makes you want to be involved in fitness and wellness.  Then met in person was pretty much hired on spot
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for the position

title: IT Support Center Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 6 interviewers that consisted of the departments manager as well as same level technicians, supervisors of the same department as well as other departments. You can look them up on the universities website to see who you will be interviewing with. I was then asked series of questions, followed by a role play. The questions were fairly simple, but the key is to remember to say that if you can't figure something out to pass it onto the next level technicians to show you are a team player. The role playing consisted of a user calling in who was having an MS Word issue that I exhausted all options with and they still had the issue. The correct answer would have been to try your solutions then pass it onto the next stage technician. Following the role play, I was able to ask questions. Be careful with the questions you ask them! Be very vague and general, nothing that makes the interviewers think too hard. The supervisor for this department does not like being questioned. He felt I asked an unfair question and started to raise his voice to me. I had previously looked up this question online and multiple career sites said it was okay to ask. I asked if my skill set was something that matched well with their department. He did not respond to it directly, said it was unfair of me to ask, and said that he will not give me an answer. Another supervisor of another department answered me in a very general but professional way (the answer I was looking for). The other supervisor told me that they are looking for someone they can mold into what they need, and that experience plays a huge role, but so does personality. Also, do not ask what the time frame is that they will call you back if you are considered. This question also upset him for some reason. There is only 1 female who works in this department and she is blonde and skinny. After looking at the teams website, everyone on the 24/7 team is white. I am Hispanic, and overweight. I feel like looks and race play a huge role to this department. At the very end they let me know that they will let you know within a week if you're considered. Overall, this interview was turned around on me and my questions made me look bad. Interview lasted approximately 50 minutes.
Interview Questions: Q: If you were a superhero which super power would you want and why?

title: Ticket Seller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Inquired about a position and if they were hiring. Sent an application online (Wednesday). Got a call next day (Thursday) to schedule an interview for following day (Friday). After my interview they got back in touch with me after weekend and officially hired on Monday.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you experienced a problem while working on a team?

title: Clinical Skills Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Phoenix, AZ) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online after a colleague told me about the position and was called in for an interview. A very thorough job description was posted online with many questions to answer. There were many applicants but I am not sure how many interviewed. Everyone was very nice. The job started about 1 month after I interviewed.
Interview Questions: How long I have worked in the field

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Basic resume questions, talk about life goals, programming and research skills. Very Easy interview, PI just basically wanted to know if you were a good for for the lab. Make sure you read up on what research the lab has done in the past and is currently doing.
Interview Questions: Do you know any computer programming?

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very formal and structured interview with generic questions designed to make you elaborate on your answer. Like most large entities, they conduct a panel/group interview with the whole team there, They are very punctual so be on time meaning at least 15 min before. Dress attire should be business formal for your interview. Take your time answering the question and do elaborate as much as possible.
Interview Questions:
Major failure that you experienced and how you overcame that situation?
How would you be successful at performing the assigned tasks?
What type of management do you like or dislike?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: There is an online application, then an individual interview, then a group interview. Not everyone gets a group interview. The application opens around winter break and is due the first week of January. The whole process takes up until March when they tell you if you got a position in a dorm or not.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Must apply online, do a one on one interview, which is 45 minutes and all questions need to be answered, then the final interview was done in a group to see how well everyone works together.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very casual. First a phone interview, then was invited for an in-person interview about a week later. Small department with people who had worked together for many years. I suspect they were looking for a specific personality or fit as they worked very closely and had a system down that they preferred for day to day operations.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stupid people?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews that consisted of individual and group. The individual group interview is roughly 30 minutes long. The group interview is roughly 30 minutes and consists of a group of 3 to 4 students. The group interview consisted of assembling the tallest paper tower with a set number of string, tape, and paper with your group members.

title: Lab Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I met with my would-be boss in my would-be lab. The interview process was fairly casual and quick. Then they asked me basic questions like why do I want to work for the company? What I did at my previous employer? and  When I would be able to begin if I where to be hired?. Then the interviewer continued by explaining there benefits, and the explaining when I could expect to becontacted if i where to get second interview which would be on site. The interviewer ended the interview with asking me I had any questions for them?.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Our professor sent out a mass email to the department with the director's contact info. I submitted CV/portfolio to the director and I got an email back within a week. Got an interview that same week and got a job offer about a week later.

title: Student Floor Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was more based on how candidates looks at customer service, though the job is related to IT troubleshooting. Interviewers were friendly and approachable. Results of interview were available within committed time period. Overall nice experience in interview.

title: Student Worker Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview was rather informal and mostly through email. After a few emails back and forth, I was asked to come in to discuss availability and choose a training date to start as well as covering all basic job duties to make sure I understood what I would be doing.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted via email for a phone interview about 3 weeks later. There was a slight mix up on UA's side on the day of the interview so we rescheduled for later in the week.  This threw me off. We had everything in writing confirming both date and time and they didn't double check their calendars.  I spoke to the potential manager and her supervisor.  I haven't heard back from this one and there are no status updates on their website but it's been a month so I assume I wasn't selected.
Interview Questions: Provided background about the position and then asked about my background and experiences with similar programs, conflict resolution, strengths, short term and long term goals.  They also asked about my flexibility as this position involved traveling and evening/weekend hours.

title: Senior Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth. I applied for a position that was vacant, and they needed to fill, so it went quickly. I was referred to the position by a University employee, submitted an application, and was called to schedule an interview the next day. The interview was scheduled for a week later, and I got a call with a job offer the next day.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you didn't agree with a decision your supervisor made. How did you handle it?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ)

My previous experience in writing and reviewing Journal papers helped me a lot in securing this position along with the nice things my reference had to say in the recommendation letter.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jul 2015

Interview Questions: How would I handle someone who called in and was asking for confidential info?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: First was an email and then a followup call from the HR representative. A phone interview was scheduled for the following week. Phone interview went well overall. They didn't ask a lot of questions and allowed me to talk at length on several subjects. Next an in person interview was scheduled. Overall it went well except for the first question that was a strange opener and didn't come off well nor did I answer it as well as expected. After that it went well.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were about process and conflict resolution. The very first question was describing all the steps in the project management process. The other questions were very good overall and what you would expect from a power house management team like this and a senior position. If not for the poor first question and waiting 90 days to get through their hiring decision, I would have rated positive.

title: Clinical Research Specialist-I Interview

title: College of Information Interview

title: S A L T Center Tutor Interview

title: Web Developer Interview

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: What I see my long term goals are.

title: Police Officer Interview
