Interview Descriptions: Process included a physical agility, 3-4 person panel interview and background check. Once there was an offer for employment then there is a meeting with the Chief of Police.
Interview Questions: As an experienced officer coming into this interview the questions given were somewhat expected.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: GPA is important, as are GRE scores and letters of recommendation. They will fly you out if they admit you, and you will have the opportunity to meet with faculty and learn from them.They tend to treat the interview process as a way of you learning about them, not the other way around.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question is regarding your previous work. Get an explanation down to 2 minutes or less.

title: IT Support Center Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
This was for a position as a tech in their 24/7 support center.  4 person panel, 2 of which were manager, 1 tier-2 tech and 1 level 1 tech.

1/2 and 1/2 technical questions to guage my knowlegde and experience and "soft skills" questions like "What do you consider great customer service?" "How would you handle explaining something to a NON technical user?"

They were all very kind and laid back.  I didn't feel stressed or pressured.  All questions seemed 100% applicable to position I was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: "Describe a time you got great customer service"

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I took a class with the professor and she liked the work I did. She asked me to work with her PhD and Master's students to help get work done. She decided that she liked my work and kept me on as an undergraduate research assistant. I then moved on as a graduate research assistant.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work as a research assistant?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: First apply through web portal. Then there is online application screening. No in-person follow-up, no phone contact for reference. Then there are two rounds of interview. Questions are typical for accountant position.                                                                                                                                                .
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you have different opinions with your supervisor.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online. Contacted for a phone interview that lasted about 45 minutes. Invited back for an in person interview that consisted of a round table of an interview and a presentation that I had prepared.
Interview Questions: Describe a time in which you had to deal with a difficult person

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Team interview with departmental staff. They asked me about my resume, past work experiences, and attitudes in the workplace. We discussed duties and responsibilities for the position. The questions were geared towards understanding where I would fit in the office setting, which already had about 8-10 employees plus departmental faculty and students. Some faculty can be jerks, and the interviewers wanted to see how I would handle working with big egos and such.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Souvenirs Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Work as a seasonal employee at first then can be brought on for the rest of the semester if a spot opens in a department. This might happen after a few seasonal rushes.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you

title: Support Systems Analyst, Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: apply with online application and cover letter, pass HR's minimum requirements, first round of interviews, get selected for 2nd round.  Then the 2-3 candidates will meet the staff they will work with and the team will decide
Interview Questions: Please tell us something you are not?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: My advisor had an opening and described the nature of the research project to me.  The project was consistent with my own research interests.  We then discussed the duties I would be responsible for, and I agreed to join her team of researchers.  My sense is that interviews for Graduate Research Assistantships at universities are often similar to this one, in the sense that the employer (in this case, my advisor) has a candidate in mind before the interviewing process even begins.  That said, it is important to be prepared for questions about your background and experiences.
Interview Questions: I was asked what my interests were, what I wanted to do career wise, how my skills would contribute to the research project.

title: Media ASUA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy to apply and great motivated student interviewers.  Though it is a large school it does seem like a very close knit community.  The students interviewing were on the ASUA.  They were very quick about scheduling an interview.
Interview Questions: Just be yourself and show strengths as a leader.

title: PhD Student and Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I visited the campus, met with faculty, submitted an application and was accepted to the program. This was for a PhD program in the College of Education. The program is better than I expected. The application process was easy and there was a lot of support from faculty and staff to help me through the process. There is funding available, but you have to be assertive to make sure you are getting the maximum funding possible to help cover the costs of the program.
Interview Questions: I was asked to complete the standard application for admission

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Round 1 of interviews was a group, with both your bosses and people currently working that job. Then I got to have a little tour of the office and talk to the head of the department.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you had to persuade people to do something.

title: Ops Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a sit down conversation with the manager. They talked about my life experience and what I hope to get out of the job. It was good to learn how to interview and eventually translate these skills to interviewer my eventual replacement. The hiring process is very casual and not very demanding. Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: How do you lead people?

title: Weight Room Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the University of Arizona’s campus recreation center as a part time weight room monitor in December of 2013. I got lucky because it is very hard to get selected for an interview, usually you have to know someone that will you into it. It was a one on one interview and that was it.
Interview Questions: What makes you right for the job?

title: Computer Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Just need to demonstrate customer service abilities and troubleshooting. Not much else is really involved in the interview. I left thinking that I was more than qualified to do the job.
Interview Questions: How have you handled a specific computer troubleshooting problem?

title: Pathology Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I stayed across the street from the hospital in a bed and breakfast, then I had breakfast with the residents, attended morning conference, and began my day with two interviews in the morning. I then went out to lunch with two senior residents and got to ask all of my questions. We came back, I had two more interviews, and left for the airport that night. It was a pretty standard experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come here?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got an email detailing where to meet in the Student Union on Campus. I could tell they were getting a lot of candidates because there were a lot of us in the waiting room. The area where I was interviewed was full of cubicles and as I walked past I could see others being interviewed. It made me feel as if they didn't read my resume, they just wanted people to fill positions immediately.
Interview Questions: How strong are your leadership skills?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I was hired as a postdoc in the same lab that I got my PhD from. Hence, there was no interview process to mention. However, I did have to go through human resources and apply as an outside applicant. The process took almost a month to finalize nut it wasn't too baad or too complicated.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Contact the professor to make an appointment on the posting position, and then upload your resume to the professor. During the interview, the professor would ask your skills and interests in that specific area
Interview Questions: What did you do on your undergraduate thesis?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: short interview with the primary investigator and then short interviews with other persons working in the lab. Spend time doing a tour of the lab and talked with some of the post docs in the lab.
Interview Questions: how do you purify proteins

title: Garage Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: two person interview with the Ops manager and a garage supervisor, normal interview questions regarding integrity and challenging situations and how they were handled, advised of expectations. easy interview processes. Went over all policies required for the job to make sure capable of performing including describing cash handling experience
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to diffuse a angry customer and how did you resolve the situation?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Easy to be employed during RUSH season which means the start of each semester. Interview conducted as what are your strengths and weaknesses? what other type of job related experience do you have (if so)....
Interview Questions: What is your weakness?

title: Technical Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was interesting, mundane at the most. Being over 2 years ago, it is difficult to remember all of the key details. However, the hiring process was fair, and the turn-around time was fast.
Interview Questions: Are you available to work weekends?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Interviews are completed in a panel fashion. Generally, the hiring supervisor and individuals who would be your peers are your panel members. You are asked to create a presentation that you would present to a "class" of high school students interested in attending the university and you start your interview with the presentation. After you complete your presentation, you then are asked standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: You are asked to create a presentation covering the basics about the University. There is no template provided, you just have to include what you feel is important.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Informal meeting in person in which a few questions were asked. It was very straightforward. People were engaging and welcoming. They were interested in how you could be benefited from the internship as well as how you could best contribute. The interview occurred after an online inquiry from another student. It was quite simple and the interviewee was very direct and open.
Interview Questions: What are your plans for the future?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was working with this department in a consultative fashion prior. Multiple meetings/interview sessions. Discussions about job itself, role, scope, future direction.  Took a bit of negotiation and about four weeks to close.
Interview Questions: We discussed culture, vision, management styles, areas of responsibility.

title: SALT Center Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Standard Behaviorial questions. They really didn't have many summer tutors at the time so I was a shoo-in for the position. That being said I worked throughout the year as well.
Interview Questions: How would you tutor someone who was being difficult?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Initial scanning application, 2 rounds of interviews
Interview Questions: what's your philosophy in life and work?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: It was easy as a cake walk here.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions:
After sending your résumé, cover letter and schedule through the schools job site, I got a call for an interview a little over a week later.   Scheduled an appointment for two days later.  Finding the office was confusing because the entrance did not have any signs and did not look like a front door but a back door.  No one addressed this.  

The interview itself was extremely short, 5  minutes or so, and the person who was supposed to interview me was running late so I was interviewed by another later under that person.  Only one real question was asked an the rest was explaining what the job position was like.  It did not look as if they reviewed my information beforehand.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with data entry?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: Technical Interview with the previous person who was working there for 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: Nothing was really difficult as I had complete knowledge of the processes that was carried out at the department.

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona
Interview Descriptions: I was hired based on my internal performance in another department.  Recruitment often takes place internally and the interview process changes dramatically.  I submitted an application, was interviewed face to face, and was hired.  Because I had a record of success in my previous position and a good review from my employer, there was less red tape.
Interview Questions: What would you change about this program?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Application is done online, it takes a while for processing. The interview was two parts and held in the office of the person hiring me. To apply I needed a resume, cover letter and writing sample. University of Arizona requires you to pledge alliance to Arizona when you are employed, whatever that means.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: good, I guess. It was lengthy and had too many logic questions for my taste. The most difficult one had to do with the cabin that has four windows on each side of the house, and there's a bear outside. What color is the bear. Think about it.
Interview Questions: STAR questions, behavioral questions, logic questions

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Hoboken, NJ) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Online application, some phone interview questions and wait. Most of the questions are about what kind of projects I have worked on, what paper I have published and what is the grade of my last degree
Interview Questions: based on resume

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Through graduate school application.  The interview was really for graduate school entrance.  Once selected to have an interview, I was invited to the University for 2 days to have a tour and interviews with each of the faculty members.  The interviews took place in 2012.
Interview Questions: Tell us why you applied for our program?

title: Senior Sous Chef Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions:
The process involves 4 interviews taken at random depending on availability of area manger.
Each manager who has been there some time( 10+ plus years) has a chance to meet you at the primary interview with the Executive Chef `s introduction.Then the consultant group meet you and asks questions followed by the operations manger over the student union.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working with such a large staff ?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: BAsed on experience and merit.
Interview Questions: Not applicable in my case

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was one on one with one of the development officers on the development team in the dean's office. It lasted about 30 minutes and the questions weren't too difficult. They hire freshmen and sophomores so they know that your experiences aren't too diverse yet. They want you to do well!
Interview Questions: Teamwork skills

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: My resume was forwarded on to a different department who was needed to do extra desk and clerical work. Two people from the department interviewed me very casually to get to know me more-so than reading straight from my resume.
Interview Questions: Why are you taking this job?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by someone who had the role in the past, they introduced me to the hiring manager and we had an in person interview. Nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: What is your major and what is your class schedule like?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Took the english proficiency test with a computer. Basically you just talk to a program. A lot like TOFEL speaking test. After a week I received an email saying that I was accepted.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was given a detailed overview of the project by the project PI.  The PI also outlined the major research directions and progress to-date.  I was then asked a series of questions related to how my background and research pertained to these research directions and where I saw myself best contributing.  My answers prompted follow-up questions.  The entire interview lasted between 30 min - 1 hour.
Interview Questions: How would you detect edge features in an image?

title: BookStores Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview for this position was very laid back; however, I had met the interviewers before and could see how it could be more formal in a standard situation. Questions included detailed behavioral and situational methods.
Interview Questions: Proof of previous success and examples. Although it seems like an obvious question, the level of technical information requested caught me off guard.

title: Research Assistant Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Prior to moving to the area, I sent out a number of emails to program directors and faculty with similar interests in the hopes of securing funding. After an interview, I was offered a research position in an great lab, but the offer ended up being made too late to include health insurance benefits for the semester.
Interview Questions: I was asked to provide a solution to a computer vision problem.

title: Fitness Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Need to do 20 minutes audition before getting hired.Basically you need to prepare 4 songs. The fitness coordinator will take your class to check your verbal cuing, choreography, etc. If you can prepare well, you will pass. Also, for safety consideration, you need to get CPR certification before getting hired.
Interview Questions: The fitness coordinator will take your class to check your verbal cuing, choreography, etc.

title: Library Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easiest interview I have had. I was only asked for my class schedule and when I could start. The hiring process was easy, had to meet with HR and give all my information. There is also a simple test you have to take.
Interview Questions: What is your schedule

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: This is an academic position. Statement of research, CV, and 3 letters. It's the standard thing. After that, there was some negotiation on the phone, but that was basically it. Standard networking expectations apply, since academia is basically who-you-know and all. There was a background check as part of University hiring, but that was the only real hoop to jump through.
Interview Questions: Please provide a brief statement of research.

title: Executive Assistant to Department Head Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Three separate interviews: The first with an HR rep and an employee that has worked for the department 25+ years, second interview with Department Administrator, third interview with Department Head

HR communicated with me during the entire process via email and phone.

Interview process occurred over a two week period.

Was offered top amount possible in salary range for my position.
Interview Questions: Why specifically do you want to work for this department at the UA?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very good input on previous research or work in undergraduate degree. Highly motivated faculty who will make sure you get things done, no matter what. You will be interviewing with some of the smartest people whom you will ever see in your life. So, please don't BS. Be genuine and reading, reading and reading is the only thing that will help.
Interview Questions: Describe research and then the questionnaire will keep going down the rabbit hole.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Email notice sent by department advisor, interview with instructor of the course. Training required before starting work.
Interview Questions: How will teach other students?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was part of my application to graduate school in chemistry.They evaluate your performance at differences stages: placement exams, visitation weekend and a final interview. It is important to pass at least 3 out of 5 exams in order to not take additional classes the first semester which is kind of rough given the huge workload it is imposed.
Interview Questions: It varies. It depends on your performance

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Met with the professor, talked about in available projects and my skill set. Talked about what I am interested, and started working. There were many projects I could work on, but not all had funding. I liked the department overall, and the facilities were good too. Spoke with other faculty to get an idea of their field and the projects they have.
Interview Questions: What do you want to learn? And why? What excites you?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Just a simple talk with the professor I work for.
Interview Questions: What is your major.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Application, cover letter and resume submitted, called for an interview. Interviewed with supervisor's assistants
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions

title: Accounts Payable Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Nothing to strenuous, for my position no basic knowledge about it was required. First had a interview by student HR, then had an interview with my manager. I dressed business casual. Took no more than 30 minutes for each interview. Followed up with a thank you letter to both student HR and manager.
Interview Questions: If I work good in groups

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The department flew me out and paid for my hotel for a recruitment weekend in February. Overall, the weekend was very organized, and I had the opportunity to tour various buildings, laboratories, and meet with professors as well as senior graduate students to discuss their experiences. *Note: I believe due to recent state level budget cuts, department recruitment is now seriously lacking. The department is short on money for recruitment, and not many of the faculty have grants to pay their graduate students.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to pursue a PhD degree and what would you like to accomplish with an advanced degree?

title: Store Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with director and then with several staff members.  The questions were easy if you have the background/experience of retail.  The interview also consisted of a tour of the bookstore.
Interview Questions: What is your experience?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I do a lot of work to prepare the application. Due to my background on physics and optics, I was admitted by my current professor as a full time research assistant. The research field matches my background and therefore all interviews went smooth.
Interview Questions: Connecting remotely is not an efficient work due to time difference

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing was conducted for entry into the graduate program. The interview process was a smooth process and the graduate college was a very gracious host to prospective students. I met with each of the professors in the department individually for about 30 minutes each to interview for the position (6 in total). I was notified within 2 months of acceptance into the program.
Interview Questions: What were some of the reasons I was interested in joining the graduate program.

title: Design Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was one-on-one with my project supervisor. I was escorted to his office by his secretary. i introduced myself. He glanced over my resume and asked questions related to my attitude, ambition, personality, work ethics, ability to progress and not give up etc. Interview was relaxed and related to overall achievements in the past. And more technical specific to the particular position of interest.
Interview Questions:
Have you worked in bio-medical field ? Explain your experience ?
Job is related to 'microwave heating of cancer tumor', do you have good expertise with microwaves ?
Where did you work before ? explain job assignments?
What salary do you expect ?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Took a long time after submitting application. Several months actually, I had all but given up on the prospect of being hired. But once I was contacted it was a speedy process.One interview, tons of paper work, employment id badge. Easy process actually.
Interview Questions: Past experience

title: Police Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is quite long and can vary in length depending on the background check. Once the background check is completed and successfully passed, the three person panel interview consists of hypothetical questions relating to police/security scenarios. Come prepared to be asked a lot of questions.
Interview Questions: Our mission is to become "Partners with our community." How would you encompass this into your everyday work interactions with the public?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Email based application with no phone or in-person interview. 
They only checked with my references. The offering process was very quick.
Interview Questions: There was basically no such a formal interview. They only looked at my CV, talked to my references and offered.

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application via the online system, and immediately identified individuals (via LinkedIn) that could help with the process. Initial interview was via phone screening. 2nd interview was a panel interview, which would have been done over the phone, but I chose to fly to Tucson to interview in person (wanted to meet the staff). The University did not fund this interview trip. The final round was a UA paid trip to Tucson, where I interviewed with the panel again, had a 1:1 interview with the Vice President of the unit (this was also the hiring manager), and gave a presentation to a group of 50 people on how I would market the UA as a Land Grant university. After this round, it was several weeks before an offer was made. The entire process took 6 months, so there was a lot of waiting and wondering.
Interview Questions: What is your understanding of a Land Grant University, and why is this important?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard.  Including a background check.  They offered to pay moving expenses.
Interview Questions: There weren't any difficult or unexpected questions. The interview was pretty straight forward and it seemed like they had made a decision prior to the interview based solely on letters of recommendation.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was well-managed. There was easy communication with support staff arranging the trip. I met with director and department faculty members one on one. I taught a sample class, then gave a job talk based on my research. I was introduced to local supporters of the department. Most meals were with members of search committee. First breakfast with director, second breakfast with two search committee members. A dinner with faculty, lunch with graduate students.
Interview Questions: Not unexpected but useful to have clear details about funded research and next proposal envisioned.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Corona de Tucson, AZ) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty standard. The questions were pretty standard and the interaction with the panel was what is generally expected. Questions were created before the interview and they were divided amongst the panel members. The questions were also generic and were designed to understand my reaction to particular scenarios, more behavior based.
Interview Questions: I was asked to compose a mock email in 30 minutes which was asking an executive for clarity on a document they created.

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions:
I had a meeting with grad students in PI's lab. The lunch with all group members followed the meeting.
Overall, it was so hot not to think in calm. Never go outside in summer.
Interview Questions:
What is future plan for 3 years at the U of A.
Who are the potential collaborators in the department and the scool?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was purely technical and it was one on one. It is a state job no negotiations.
Interview Questions: What do you think about topic X?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interview began with a presentation.  Group interview was very structured which felt a bit stifling.  Team had a list of questions and went around the room taking turns asking the prewritten questions and making notes on my answers.  There were few follow up questions to the answers.  I was given a skills task and then had a 1:1 interview with the Director.   They got back to me next week.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: After posting a resume I received a personal phone call from my supervisor to set up an interview time. The interview was with three supervisors and two future coworkers. It was informal and lasted about two hours including a question and answer session and a tour. After hire, I have learned that business casual is the acceptable dress for the interview process, over-dressing is not recommended.
Interview Questions: If you have the same nucleotide concentration of a solution containing a 1000bp amplicon and a solution containing a 500bp amplicon, which amplicon do you have more copies of?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Arizona (Tucson, AZ) in Oct 2007
Interview Descriptions: I first applied online, then was called in  for a panel interview. The all process was pretty easy, I was asked about background questions, state why i was the best candidate for the job. The University does not oofer good pay, but you get a lot health, vacation benefits, plus tuition reduction if your a qualified employee.
Interview Questions: What makes you the best candidate for the job?
